Reviews.Title: “Trekking across Italy...”
Reviews.Author: garnet8
Reviews.Content: If it were not for the cute little "alleys" and bridges we went through and across, I would have been upset because we had a bit of a hard time finding the hotel and when we finally came to the piazza it was in, I thought ok this is going to be interesting. My only complaint and it's really not that serious was the stairs. I thought the reception and the gentleman manning the desk were wonderful, he was a great help. Our room was nice and inviting. Very clean and the bathroom was a nice size. The location was perfect, we walked all over the place and then did a walking tour and a gondola ride. Fabulous food and the people where nice. I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small and discreet”
Reviews.Author: cjpvision
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in Jan/Feb 2012. Hidden away just a short walk from St Marks Square - hence excellent location. Room was small but adequate, as was the ensuite and shower. Decor a bit quirky and dark, but maybe that's the venetian style? Continental breakfast was fine and the staff were polite and helpful. Just beware the 2 flights of stairs and the tiny doorway you have to negotiate to get into this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jhonydh
Reviews.Content: Location and price is the main reason we stayed in this hotel. Room is small but clean. Breakfast standard. Service average.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, superb location”
Reviews.Author: POHB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Oct 2011. Lovely location right near St Marks, almost hidden behind a door and up steep stairs (don't come here if you can't climb stairs with baggage). Very friendly, small reception/breakfast area always manned with someone to help out if needed. Simple but nice buffet breakfasts. Had one very bad night when a water tank or somesuch was v noisy over our room all night but it was inaudible elsewhere and they sorted it out as soon as we told them so can't blame them for that. Not an immaculate bland international hotel but a very good hotel of its type and amazing value for the location. Of course, eating out nearby was hugely expensive, but that's what you get for being in the heart of tourist land, the Spa shop is only 15 mins walk away for cheaper supplies.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4eTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice for the price, and great for location just behind St Marks Sq. A little obscure to find, and daunting staircase to enter. Quadruple Room was small, but adequate, and clean. Staff very friendly and helpful, breakfast very nice. Stayed in room 3, and found a previous occupant had left a Samsung HTC phone in the safe (it was easy done, the phone case was magnetic, and I only found it because I couldn't find my kindle light so I ran my hand around the inside of the safe. Turned the phone over to the staff member on the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: luckysam12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated at the heart of Venice, within very close proximetry to St Marks square. It is accessed via a steep stair case which is not suitable for disabled visitors. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We booked the family room which consisted of a double bed and two single beds, which was adequated for our short stay. There was a double wardrobe and limited drawer space provided. The en-suite bathroom had a walk in shower and sink and toilet. We made our reservation direct with the hotel as this allowed us to received a discount. The hotel was reasonably priced in comparison to all other accommodation in Venice. The breakfast consisted of cereals, bread rolls, cheese, hams, yoghurt, fruit, croissants etc. with ample amounts of freshly brewed coffee. Overall, the trip was enjoyable and if we return to Venice we will definitely go back to hotel San Gallo due to the location and friendliness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: john T
Reviews.Content: While it is only a 5 minute walk from the boat, you still must tow your luggage over a couple bridges and when you enter the hotel door the flight of stairs up looks daunting. If your in average shape , no problem, but for some it could be an issue. The room was very clean but tiny, breakfast was good and the staff was friendly and helpfull . Even though it was so close to St. Mark's square and the Hard Rock cafe' it was realy quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: Laguna5
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Tucked just behind st marks square. This is a tiny hotel upstairs from a glass blowing gallery. It's ok but for the price I expect decent pillows not "pancakes". This hotel needs to fix that detail.

Reviews.Title: “Right for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jappi
Reviews.Content: The location is fabulous, ofcourse the rooms arent huge but clean and comfortbale. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: dol12
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The decor, the cleanliness, the location and the staff. Not too expensive and for the location and state of the rooms, the price is more then worthy. Definitely recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; nice people!”
Reviews.Author: RODRIG_CA
Reviews.Content: Venice is amazing! This hotel was great too!! It's quaint and the people who work there are super nice and helpful. They carried our luggage up the gigantic set of stairs at the entrance, which was a plus because unfortunately, there is no elevator. The rooms are to be expected for Venice, over the top in decor, but nice-cozy-clean. They have an awesome breakfast that is included in your stay, which is up on the terrace overlooking the neighboring buildings. It's close to St. Marks Square which is a plus. I plan on staying here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 302chrissie
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews and was prepared to have a hard time finding this hotel. Our plan was to have the group wait with all of the luggage in St Mark's square so they didnt have to lug it around while we found it. That was the best idea. Once we found the hotel we were able to get everyone there in one piece. The hotel is on the 2nd floor and you will need to tackle a lot of stairs and push past the tourists waiting to see the glass blowing. Once in the lobby you will be checked in pretty quickly. We loved our room - it was smaller for a Quad but very comfortable. Some might call gaudy but it was fun and kept us in that Venice feel. We also had access to the terrace which was where breakfast was served every morning. Our group often gathered there for happy hour and it was beautiful. The breakfast had the best cappaccino and espresso. You can't beat the location and the price was right for a St. Marco location. I would recommend this hotel to others and would also return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel/location”
Reviews.Author: cuterosie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The San Gallo for three nights last week. This was our second time there, the first being about 4 years ago. From start to finish the San Gallo was excellent and just as we remembered, only better. The staff were always pleasant and helpful. Our room was absolutely fine, small, but you have to expect that in Venice, spotlessly clean and the location could not be bettered. All in all we had the most wonderful time and we will certainly return to the San Gallo in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff and value for money”
Reviews.Author: jennyg1965
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little difficult to find, but once we did find it was in a great location, just off St Mark's Square and easy walking distance to the vaporetto. A steep climb up the stairs to reception but we managed and I'm sure the staff would have helped if we'd asked. The room was clean and had everything that we needed, but very small! The bed was comfortable and the area quiet, we slept very well, except for the night that a school group was staying and there were kids running up and down the passages yelling out to one another and slamming doors after 12.00 midnight, but the man on reception sorted them out once I went and complained. No view, our window opened out onto a wall and a pigeon woke us up one morning while cooing on the window sill! Breakfast was ok, have had a lot worse, but not much variety. You can pay to use the computer and they let us print our boarding passes when we were ready to leave. The staff were very helpful. Make sure you do the clock tower tour while in Venice - it was wonderful. Either book online or at the Correr Museum. A must do!

Reviews.Title: “Great location if a little noisy!”
Reviews.Author: warrencammack
Reviews.Content: Right next to the main square this is a perfect place to base yourself to explore Venice. The staff were both friendly and helpful and the breakfast wasn't bad either. The main problem was of a night the rooms look over the small San Gallo square which houses a theatre and is a thoroughfare for people coming home from restuarants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in need of a total facelift, staff training and exterminator”
Reviews.Author: Nansdrivel
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Gallo is in a wonderful location, especially if you're on your first trip to Venice. It's close to St. Mark's but far enough away to feel secluded. Be prepared for a long hike upstairs when you arrive, and don't expect a warm welcome from the staff. They really should at least pretend to welcome you. And sadly, my husband, mother-in-law and I were eaten alive by bugs. They really need to train the staff and get a quality exterminator in there as soon as possible. The good news was the rooms were comfortable and the breakfast was decent. Just needs a good clean-up and friendlier staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Easy to Find”
Reviews.Author: divinefeeling
Reviews.Content: Great location a short walk and not too many steps from the vaporetto stop. Be warned though, there is a long staircase up to the Albergo and more steps depending upon which floor your room is on. we were on the first floor, though next to the kitchen...Reasonably quiet area, except for the renovations in the Theatre downstairs. Breakfast selection was OK. Room was OK, average size by Italian standards. Pillows were like rocks! All of them. location was great, handy to vaporetto, st mark's square, etc.

Reviews.Title: “great location- tiny room”
Reviews.Author: SaraGood
Reviews.Content: It is located right in the heart of San Marco so once you find it, you are set. The room was VERY small. There was less than 6 inches of space from the bed to the wall. Not the placeto stay if you want to slee in because the crowds come out early but you are close to everything. Don't get sucked into the Venice play at the theater next door- serious waste of money

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for room 21!”
Reviews.Author: TriumphST
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are very pleasant and the location for a weekend stay in Venice is superb as it is only 50 metres from Piazza San Marco. However it is very expensive for what it is and there are numerous problems, especially if you stay in room 21. There are two windows, one on each side of the room and both look out onto kitchen air outlets which belch out the smell of fried food. Leave either window open for more than five minutes and you smell like a Big Mac and chips. The other major problem was the strange thumping noise in the night (not that sort of thumping noise!). We decided it was coming from the glassworks on the floor below - we all heard it and it woke all of us up at various times during the night on both nights. Lastly the level of mosquito was surprising for the end of October. The only good thing about room 21 was that it wasn't as tiny as some of the other rooms I've read about. Breakfast was OK - it's not their fault they have so little room for the tables. Internet access ludicrously expensive.

Reviews.Title: “very venitian, great location”
Reviews.Author: ShenaG
Reviews.Content: Don't let the pictures of the front of the hotel fool you... it is actually located in a very nice area of Venice, just a short walk from the water taxi drop off point for San Marco. The breakfast was one of the largest we experienced while in Europe and the staff spoke fluent English and were very helpful when we needed to leave our bags for the afternoon. The rooms were clean and efficient. The AC is included with no extra charge but if you leave it running all day it leaks! We had a cot placed under the AC and it leaked on in causing us to need to change the sheets and flip the matress-- but the front desk guy was very helpful with this matter even though it was very late. The terrace isn't much... they serve breakfast there when weather permits but we never experienced that even though it was beautiful both days. There isn't a view, either, but it was nice to have a drink outdoors, close to our room, at night. All in all, a good experience. It seems expensive but all of Venice seemed that way. We did not take the excursion offered because of time restraints and you have to pay for you own way back....

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what it is...”
Reviews.Author: Philie4u
Reviews.Content: The room wasn't that clean, and was really small including the shower that was really small. The reception staff were really nice and helpfull. Really well located, just 1 minute walk from St-Mark's place. The terrace for breakfast was really nice, on the roof of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, Central, Inexpensive & Special”
Reviews.Author: MarieAntoinette8
Reviews.Content: A very hot August in the centre of Venice, led us to this quirky little boutique style hotel. I would class it as more of a bed and breakfast than hotel and if you're looking for lots of amenities with on-hand help, then this is not the place for you. The room was clean and looked after and although we were not in the main building (there's another side entrance), there was still a little magic about the place. This may have been helped by the fact that we were getting married out there and wanted a base in the centre of Venice. We loved it... as wanted to spend money elsewhere, but its not for everyone. Breakfast was on a tiny rooftop and if you didn't get there early, then you would miss out. The staff were helpful and 24 hours available, but you really don't want to stay here if stairs are a problem - they are everywhere. But then, you wouldn't come to Venice if you don't really do stairs - nearly every path leads to stairs! A great stay, useful and right in the middle of everything and only 5 minutes from St Marks Square - just don't expect too much and you'll see it for what it is... If we were to do it again, we'd probably spend most of our time on the LIDO and head into Venice for a few days - the Lido, really is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Falsely Advertised - Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: M D
Reviews.Content: We, [my adult daughter and I], had booked this hotel over the internet, when we finally found it, we immediately realized we had made a big mistake and had been misled. We immediately sought an alternative. It has a huge staircase to climb, no porter, and no lift. This fact is not advertised and as I have bad knees, if I'd known, I would never have booked there. The man at the desk showed us to a rather depressingly small room with ONE bed, and an equally miniscule bathroom. When I pointed out that we had requested TWO beds, he slung back the covers and unzipped the two beds and the fact that the room was too small to move them apart, did not seem to register with him. There was no A/C and the small window opened onto an area which was stacked high with garbage bags. We told him that this is not what we had been led to believe the hotel to be and that we will not be staying. He said that we will still be charged for 1 night and as he had the details of my amex, he did just that, even though I did not sign for the charge. This hotel is not cheap and it's really not a hotel either. A tired Pensione is more accurate. Unfortunately Amex could not reverse the charge because I had booked online. Don't know why that should make a difference - but nothing I could do about it. I wrote to the 'hotel', when the charge appeared on my statement, outlining why I believe the charge was not justified and requesting a refund. They never even bothered to answer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: CrisD123
Reviews.Content: As I'm planning my next trip to Venice, I couldn't resist writing a review for the San Gallo, which contributed to a miserable stay in Venice when I was there in 2004. Our room was not in the main part of the building...we had to walk into a tiny alley way on the side of the building and then ring a bell so that we could be buzzed in. After walking up a flight of steps, we walked through another doorway (which had to be unlocked with a key and then relocked) and finally to our room. The room was alright, the bathroom was fine. Unfortunately, if one of us wanted to leave the room, we had to go back for the other as you needed the big and bulky key not only to get in, but you needed it to get through the locked door in the hallway and the key was needed to get out of the door into the alley way!!! It was a pain in the butt!! Unfortunately, sometimes a bad hotel with fairly rude staff can set a negative tone for the entire visit to Venice! Oh yeah, as I've read on many other sights, this hotel will also send you to Morano to see the glass, but nobody tells you that if you don't buy something expensive, you have to find your own way back! We were waiting for the family that we came over with in the courtyard outside of the glass factory, and they kicked us out and told us we couldn't sit there to wait and that we'd have to take the vaparreto back!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel. Good Location...”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl16
Reviews.Content: I had a good experience staying here. The location was great. Literally less than a 2 minute walk to Piazza San Marco (Saint Mark's Square). The room was a bit small. You can't stand on the left side of the bed or at the foot of the bed because there isn't enough room. But it was charming and adequate. Cute Italian interior and clean. The bathroom was even smaller, especially the shower. But it works if you can deal with small spaces. It was also very clean. The breakfast was ok - cereals, croissants, breads, cheeses and coffee. The staff was decent and somewhat helpful. The only negative factor about the hotel is that if you get a room facing the courtyard, there is a lot of noise very early in the morning. Some of the workers from nearby stores pull carts along the cobblestone around 6-7:00am. So if you're not an early riser ask for a room that doesn't face the front of the hotel. Would definitely reccomend for solo or budget conscious travelers.

Reviews.Title: “150 Euros and all I got was Nescafe”
Reviews.Author: Dragonred
Reviews.Content: A lot of times, we confuse the location of the hotel with the hotel itself. San Gallo is perfectly situated, just off St. Marks. But that's pretty much the only good thing going for this place and the reason it rates 2 stars. You have a load of stairs to climb to reach the hotel. And once inside the hotel, some more flights to your room. The person at the desk offers to carry it for you of course but you still have to do some heavy lifting of your own. Senior citizens may want to consider this aspect. Once you have reached your room, drop your luggage and spread your arms wide apart. That's when you'll meet the walls of your room. The rooms are pathetically small. By the time you unpack a bit, you have to use the bed to cross to the other side of the room. And what good is proximity to St. Marks when your room neither has a view of the square nor of the water? The bathrooms were actually much better. The aircon was a little dodgy. Shutting down and restarting on its own whim. The breakfast was quite under-whelming. And they served Nescafe from a vending machine in the kitchen! You are in Italy. The least they could do is to provide decent coffee in the morning. The hotel claims free internet but that's only between 11 AM and 11 PM with 20 minutes per room free of charge per day. Be warned. Internet in a Venetian cyber cafe is expensive. The free trip to Murano for the glass-making is only in the morning. So you'll have to plan your trip around it. I know Venice is expensive, even by Italian standards. But it beats me as to why this hotel charges so much for so little? It even puts Hong Kong hotels to shame. I'd recommend finding a place in Rialto or on Lido where your money goes further.

Reviews.Title: “faulty towers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Two English couples (age range 52-57) stayed at this hotel and were very disappointed. We cannot understand why this hotel is 3 star rated. On arrival we had to lug our suitcases up a long flight of stairs to the small reception area (a desk) and up more stairs to the bedrooms, no assistance was offered-no lifts in the hotel. The reception area converts to the "Restaurant" for breakfast time which contains a few small tables. On the second morning we went down for breakfast at 9am to be told No! No! No! by the anti-English waitress (apparently there were no tables left to accommodate us) who gave us no explanation only arm gestures. We had to go downstairs and wait outside till a table was vacant. She does not willingly give you a second cup of cappucino, or more coffee or hot water if you ask her, just hard stares - very unhelpful. One couple, unfortunately got room No.7, and was woken every morning at dawn by the persistant noise of pidgeons cooing and fluttering outside the bedroom wall, which was very annoying and very little sleep was obtained We would not recommend this hotel to any English, it was very overpriced, its only good point being the location. If we were to go again we would not stay in San Marco area but maybe near Rialto Bridge which is also an excellant location all the main sights being within a walkable distance

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel San Gallo
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 1093/A | Campo San Gallo, 30124 Venice, Italy
